alert.note: Alert for King George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 12:12AM EDT until July 13 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern King George County in central Virginia... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1212 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over King George, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... King George, Potomac Beach, Rollins Fork, Ninde, Lambs Creek, Jersey, Shiloh, Dogue and Weedonville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
